question_text:
Layla makes necklaces out of cube-shaped beads. Each bead has a volume of one cubic centimetre. She keeps the beads in a jewellery box that is shaped like a rectangular prism.

The jewellery box has a height of 6 centimetres. The bottom of the jewellery box can be completely covered by a layer of 60 beads. What is the volume of the jewellery box?
 _ cubic centimetres
solution: To find the volume of the jewellery box, you can multiply how many beads are in the bottom layer by how many layers would fill it.
There are 60 one cubic centimetre beads in the bottom layer. Since the jewellery box is 6 centimetres tall, 6 layers would fill it.
360 one cubic centimetre beads would fill the jewellery box. Therefore, the volume of the jewellery box is 360 cubic centimetres.
